title: Ancient Coin seems a little underwhelming
body:
Compared to the other support items, it's measly 35.71% gold efficiency doesn't even come close to Relics 57.14% or Spellthiefs 66.79%. The stats Coin brings is already given by Spellthiefs, and Spellthiefs gives more.

The only champions who would buy Ancient Coin is Janna and Soraka, and even then, both of them can work better with Spellthiefs.

Sure, Coin upgrades into Talisman and that active is nice for engages and disengages, but Frost Queen's Claim can boast the same. FQC can also make picks, scout an area, and provide the support with a decent amount of punching power.

Maybe there should be some changes to the Ancient Coin support path. Right now, it's the weakest of the three.

replies.body: Coin is a Sustain item. Just stand close enough to the minion wave and watch it die while you recover 30 health. Upgrade it to Nomad and you get twice the minion death sustain along with 50% HP Regen. It's not a bad item to grab on any support that has lackluster poke. If the Support can't safely and reliably proc the three tributes in the 30 second window Thief allows, I'll run Coin. This is sometimes dependent on the lane matchup. Sometimes my poke support will get counterpicked so hard that its best to run the passive coin route.

But if coin did it's job here better than relic, isn't this the item Thresh would take? I use this as a sort of litmus test, because relic really isn't that great for Thresh. If coin weren't super undertuned, it seems like it would be much more preferable for him.

You aren't wrong, it's just that coin, as a sustain item that's very different from the other two, can STILL be undertuned. No?

Honestly, the weakness of coin is a reason I don't play Thresh.  I can't stand relic on him since it leads to so much lost cs in lane, when I try to last hit and fail.  He's too squishy taking spellthief.

Thresh is more of a tank than anything, and Relic is the support item for tanks, it has HP, its upgrades have HP, its a support item that helps him build HP, cause HP is important to front line tanky supports like Thresh. It also lets him heal his ADC a bit. All together its just the best item for him of the 3 we have.

Now that said, I use coin on some tanks, that have a defensive ability like a shield or resistance steroid. Yes Thresh can shield himself, but its not instant cast, and he stops moving on top of the time it takes for the lantern to hit the ground.

Galio support is one of my favorite coin users. All armor/MR runes, combined with his W heal and coin heal mean hes so hard to poke. Spellthief isnt so good on him cause of the high mana cost on his Q and him being melee. Relic is OK and all on him, but the coin just does slightly better at letting me go in for a melee + Q combo once each minion wave. That plus regen and W heals with the coin means full health for a minor trade.

Similar story for Maokai, his E can get him some decent gold with Spellthief, it can proc twice per cast, but its still expensive. Coin lets him heal up more and stay in their face more. Though he can also sustain with Relic with his healing passive too. Mao is so versital in his item choices.

I could go on a bit more. Personaly I think the coin is pretty decent, but is undervalued. Its one of those items that people dont use cause it isnt blatantly OP or used in pro scene.

I do have a buff proposal though:

The Talisman of Ascention instead of giving 10 HP per minion... could give 1% of max HP per minion kill. On a 1000 HP max champ, it would give back 10 HP per minion kill. It would still be tied to not giving the killing blow and this would keep it from being abused by other laners. No top lane tanks cant abuse this, they have no room in their items for a zero health/resistance item that would give them back a few hundred hp for minions they didnt kill.

I think there's something to be said for strategic niches here. The coin has a bit less combat stats, but it fits a passive play style a lot better. 

Frost queen requires you to get in an enemies face in order to generate gold. If you're losing the lane this could be very dangerous, meaning you might not be able to do that. Then you're not generating gold which makes things worse. It also does nothing for health sustain. The active is great, but more focused around creating picks than the coins general purpose active.

Face of the mountain similarly puts you in danger every time you want to use it. In order to get the gold, you have to get close enough to execute a minion, giving the enemy a chance to poke you. It comes with some healing, but only enough to offset some of the potential poke that comes from getting close to enemies. It also does nothing for mana regen, so depending on who you play you have a decent chance of running out of mana fast. The active fills such a different strategic role it's like comparing apples to oranges.

The coin fills the 3rd niche which involves sitting back, and helping your adc if they get into trouble. You don't need to do anything dangerous to generate gold, gold just happens to you. At the same time, if you do get into a fight it sustains both your health and mana, allowing you to stay in the lane a lot longer/indefinitely. In addition the active is great for team fights giving an instant speed boost to everyone nearby. Since the kind of champs that take coin are focused on engage/disengage, this active is heavily beneficial to those champs.

Tbh I've always found gold efficiency to be a bad metric because you don't just need raw stats. You need the stats/effects that benefit the champ you play, and the things you want to do with them.

Relic Shield line also has one other substantial downfall; post laning phase, FQC will give you gold for participating in team skirmishes like normal, and Talisman STILL just passively generates gold for being in a lane where minions are dying. FotM grants the bonus gold solely from stopping to execute minions.
agreed. late game people clear minions so fast it becomes almost impossible to proc.
You forgot to mention that it's the least risky support item. All you have to do is be near dying minions and you're rewarded HP and gold.
The health regen on it is great for soraka and other squishy supports.

Given how health regen from items scales off of base values Soraka is actually better served with a pair of HP/5 quints and some points in the Resolve tree. Soraka's base health regeneration at level one is all of 2.5 HP/5. She is tied with Gnar for having some of the crappiest health regen in the game.

The bump at the tier two items having Frostfang give 100% Mana regen lets you keep fishing for Q hits which with a few points into the skill and some actual AP behind it results in significantly better self-heal than relying on the coin sustain. (One Q clipping any enemy champion at all is worth a minimum of 64 health healed at level one in the skill. Throw in a couple more skill levels, some AP scaling, Windspeaker's +10%, another +8% from Runic Armor... and the opposing lane is frothing at the mouth as you kite away with improved move speed and heal for over 150+ in a few seconds.)

You need to go check the item passive again.

Soraka's health regen is one of the lowest in the game, so standard regen items don't help. Ancient Coin gives health PER MINION DEATH in the lane, meaning that your adc farming will heal you over time, which is an invaluable perk for soraka and other squishy supports that have low health and low regen.

From the wiki:
On Summoner's Rift, if {{item:3301}} Ancient Coin's user is within range of all minion deaths in a lane, it provides: 5.3 health regen per 5 seconds before the 20-minute mark.

A pair of HP/5 quints is 5.4 HP/5, and frees you up to take a more offensive start that has just as much if not more sustain.

A lot of people missing the point here. I think you're right, it's a little undertuned. I think Riot has overvalued the active effect on Talisman because it was so popular on Righteous Glory. In reality, it was the stats WITH that active that made RG great, and  Talisman hasn't caught on because it just isn't.

It seems a little underwhelming because they buffed up the other starter items to be more or less on-par with it for gold generation, while talisman's weakness it that it really has no stats, it is just an group ghost that takes up an item slot instead of a summoner spell slot.

I'm not really sure if you're trying to disagree with me or not, but either way, yes. Our points align. I'm trying to say that they think that active has a lot more power than it actually has. It needs more/better stats to compete at all with the other two items.
To clarify a little, I'm saying Coin is fine, but its upgrades need impactful stats for Ascension only has regen and 10% cdr for stats.

Yeah, I see no reason why it couldn't have health, at least. For a sustain item, that makes sense all the way up the chain, coin to talisman. Adding 200-300 health would likely push it into viability.
The coin also provides benefits for the entire game whereas lategame when your carries are waveclearing it's near impossible to use Targons passive.

Taric likes ancient coin a lot as well.  But of course like Soraka and Janna, he also likes sitting on his butt and healing his carry for the first few levels.  It's nice for him to not have to run up and whack things later on in the game for money/healing.  The mana regen is nice, too.

That being said...
its first upgrade gives him nothing he can possibly care about (for 500 more gold, +2 gold per ambient minion kill, and, hmm...50% regen, yeah okay), I never upgrade it into anything, not until I've completely built at least 3 other items.  He might even want to sell it and just get {{item:2045}}, no lie.  

And as for {{item:3069}},the adc meta isn't slow-paced enough to where saving people who get caught is worth it, so every support champion is hard-pressed to find a good use for it.    And for initiating, {{item:3800}} offers a slow, 500 hp and the same amount of regen as Talisman.  Talisman is one of the worst items in the game right now.

Coming from a Taric main.

More like people don't want the "low reward", therefore they don't take it.

Buffing any form of gold generation on coin would make it outclass both spellthief and relic shield, and that's not what we want because then it would be "buy the coin every game" all over again, why do so much work when you can do *no* work? As a trade off, you gain extra sustain.

It's actually not at all bad if sustain is what you're looking for, especially in the case of against stupid hard poke matchups. I've seen even enemy tanks taking it because trying to last hit a minion for that relic shield proc would cost them *half* of their life, so it's not even worth the risk, might as well get the coin and get more out of it.

Of course, some people still take spellthief/relic simply because for the tier 3 gold items. In the end, people get *choices* to buy, instead of blindly rushing an item simply because it is "better in every way.

Like what I said (and what others said), coin is just "low risk, low reward". And no, there *are* people building it, but just not popular in this meta where bloody lanes are preferred. It doesn't mean the coin is inherently bad, it just means people don't like "low reward" stuff.
